level.text: As used in this chapter, the following terms have the meanings ascribed:
Act – the District of Columbia Board of Veterinary Practice Act of 1982, D.C. Law 4-171, D.C. Code §§2-2721 to 2-2737 (1987 Supp.).
Applicant – a person applying for a license to practice veterinary medicine under this chapter.
Board – the District of Columbia Board of Veterinary Examiners for the District of Columbia, established by the Act.

Chairperson – the Chairperson of the Board of Veterinary Examiners designated by the Mayor pursuant to §6(k) of the Act, D.C. Code §2-2725(k) (1987 Supp.), or a person designated by the board to preside at a hearing or act in place of the Chairperson.
Veterinarian – a person licensed to practice veterinary medicine under this chapter.
Veterinary Assistant – an person who is trained in animal care and who performs duties under the supervision of a veterinarian.
The definitions in §3399 of chapter 33 of this title are incorporated by reference into and are applicable to this title.
